Html:
There is widespread discussion of which versions of MS Office and Windows are being supported but I cannot find anything that identifies which Visual Studios are supported.

Could someone please point me in the right direction?

use visual studio.NET you want. the project assistant is limited to VS008/10(pro) at the moment. thats all.

Sebastian

I have VS2008 installed however all of the solution/project files with the Tutorial/Examples say that they were created with a later version of VS (2010 I assume).

I can't even rebuild the NETOFFICE source because the solution also is built with a version later than VS2008.

I really would like to take a look and play with the examples and tutorials, however I don't have access to a later version of VS.

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Regards
Todd

all examples was saved in vs2010 express format. vs2010 express is for free in other words you have to access to a later version of visual studio but anyway.
open the project files(.csproj or .vbproj) instead of the solution files(.sln) rebuild/save and you can overwrite the .sln file.

Sebastian
